thread.title_full: Florida defensive back Deiondre Porter charged with four felonies, suspended ... - Florida Times-Union

title: Florida defensive back Deiondre Porter charged with four felonies, suspended ... - Florida Times-Union
text:
Florida defensive back Deiondre Porter charged with four felonies, suspended from team Among the charges are firing into a vehicle or building 
By Garry Smits Wed, Oct 14, 2015 @ 11:48 am | updated Wed, Oct 14, 2015 @ 11:52 am Photos File photo Coach Jim McElwain said on the SEC coaches teleconference call that Deiondre Porter “was no longer with the football team.” 
The University of Florida’s week continued its bumpy run-up to playing LSU on Saturday. 
Two days after quarterback Will Grier was suspended because of the use of a substance banned by the NCAA, redshirt freshman defensive back Deiondre Porter was suspended indefinitely after being charged with four felony counts: two of aggravated assault with a deadly weapon without intent to kill, aggravated battery and firing a weapon into a vehicle or building. 
He also is charged with property damage of less than $200, a misdemeanor. 
Florida announced the suspension on Wednesday through its Twitter account. Coach Jim McElwain said on the SEC coaches teleconference call that Porter “was no longer with the football team.” 
“It’s his choice not to be with us,” McElwain said. “It’s one of those things that we don’t obviously condone. Like I said, it was his choice.” 
Porter, who was switched to defense after being an all-state quarterback at Tampa Jefferson, red-shirted last year and was playing special teams this season, with two tackles in four games. 
Porter led the state with 53 touchdowns passing and running and 4,698 yards of total offense as a senior at Jefferson in 2013. He threw for 33 touchdowns and 3,199 yards and scored 20 touchdowns and rushed for 1,499 yards.
